meanings.definition: A person or thing that spikes.
meanings.sent1: The spiker hit the volleyball with great force.
meanings.sent2: The spiker at the party always adds excitement to the games.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned into a spiker, throwing acorns at unsuspecting passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a spiker, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The spiker in the relay race sprinted to the finish line, securing the win for the team.

meanings.definition: A volleyball player who specializes in spiking the ball.
meanings.sent1: The spiker on our team always scores the most points.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the spiker slammed the ball over the net.
meanings.sent3: The spiker's powerful spikes made the opposing team tremble.
meanings.sent4: She was a spiker on the court, but a gentle soul off the court.
meanings.sent5: The spiker's precision and timing were unmatched, earning admiration from all.

meanings.definition: A nail with a large head used for fastening down roofing material.
meanings.sent1: The roofer used a spiker to secure the shingles in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to hammer the spiker firmly to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the spiker around the roof, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The spiker held the roof together during the storm, protecting the house.
meanings.sent5: The shiny spiker gleamed under the sun, a small but essential part of the roof structure.
